cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 110 miles W of the Dry Tortugas
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest across the eastern Gulf of Mexico and aiming for the northern Gulf Coast (FL Panhandle/AL border) Monday night–early Tuesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Alabama–Florida border along the northern Gulf Coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Alabama/Florida border to Ochlockonee River, FL (northern Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys, eastern Gulf of Mexico, Florida Panhandle and Alabama coast
weather_observation.wind: Brief tropical-storm-force gusts possible, but sustained TS winds unlikely (<10% chance).
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge expected along the Atlantic side of South Florida.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated totals to 8 inches could cause urban and street flooding around PortMiami.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor coastal swells and hazardous rip currents; isolated tornado risk confined mainly to Florida’s west coast, minimal for Miami.
